subject: Re: [PATCHv6 05/17] riscv/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size

reviews.author: Kiryl Shutsemau (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Kiryl Shutsemau raised no specific technical concerns about the patch, but mentioned that he will add a check for compound_info_has_mask() in response to another reviewer's comment.

reviews.author: Muchun Song
reviews.summary: Muchun Song reviewed patches related to the vmemmap optimization for RISC-V, providing Reviewed-by and Acked-by tags for several patches without raising any specific technical concerns.

reviews.author: David (arm)
reviews.summary: David (arm) raised concerns about the alignment of vmemmap to maximal folio size, specifically questioning whether it's possible for a folio to cross zones and suggesting that HVO should not be possible for certain sizes.

reviews.author: Usama Arif
reviews.summary: Usama Arif raised concerns that the patch does not work for ARM, specifically pointing out an issue with calculating the order of huge pages due to undefined behavior in ilog2(0).
sentiment_signals: patch does not work for ARM

reviews.author: Vlastimil Babka
reviews.summary: Vlastimil Babka expressed concerns about the patch to align vmemmap for riscv, specifically questioning whether shared tail pages should be per node or per node+zone.

reviews.author: Matthew Wilcox
reviews.summary: Reviewer Matthew Wilcox questioned the correctness of returning the zone number of the head page instead of the current page, suggesting it might not matter and asking for clarification in the commit message.
